Hi

There is an initialisation bug when there is more than one output.  It =
is detailed in https://sourceforge.net/tracker/?func=3Ddetail&aid=3D1594074=
&group_id=3D175856&atid=3D874910 and is a very easy code change.  I will ge=
t round to fixing it in download version just as soon as I have fixed a bug=
 in neat4j v2.

Cheers

Matt

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "vincedx15" <vin=
ce15@...> wrote:
>
> Hi, I'm working with neat4j but I need to make it stop=
pable in order to resume an evolution later. I did it saving the serializat=
ion of the population object. The evolution starts and moves through epochs=
. Unfortunately I'm experiencing a problem in the NEATSpecieManager class. =
From line 49:
> 
> if (applicantGenes[applicantIdx] instanceof NEATLinkGene=
) {
> 	weightDiffTotal +=3D (((NEATLinkGene)applicantGenes[applicantIdx]).g=
etWeight() - ((NEATLinkGene)repGenes[repIdx]).getWeight());
> }
> 
> The su=
m of weightDiffTotal at line 50 looks at the weight property of NEATLinkGen=
e or NEATNodeGene, because Genes can be both Links and Nodes. 
> Unfortunat=
ely, for some reason, sometimes, I get a ClassCastException because it cast=
s the object to a Link even if it's a Node.
> The applicantIdx as a certain=
 value... let's say, 80, while repIdx is 1.
> To solve this I simply catch =
the exception and skip the instruction... and I know that this is bad! That=
's why I'm here.
> Should i change the cast and comprare Links with Nodes? =
To be honest... i'm not really sure of what's going on here.
> 
> I hope yo=
u can help me. Thanks!
>
